meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in passing
meanings.sent1: She outpasses her classmates in running speed.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah is known for outpassing other animals in a race.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise joked that he was outpassing the hare in the slow and steady race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outpass all obstacles was like a bright beacon in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outpassing the speed of sound created a thunderous boom.

meanings.definition: The act of going beyond or surpassing in passing
meanings.sent1: His outpassing of the finish line was celebrated by the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The outpassing of the previous record brought great pride to the team.
meanings.sent3: The outpassing of the train by the cyclist was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The outpassing of expectations by the student impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The outpassing of the river's edge led to a beautiful hidden waterfall.
